title: Mass pushed up by a spring

content.question: An experiment is performed to determine the unknown mass of a sphere. A spring-loaded launcher is used to launch the sphere. The launcher is set to exert a force with an average magnitude of <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the sphere over a distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The sphere is launched vertically upward and takes a time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to reach a height <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure. Which of the following gives the minimum data needed to determine the mass of the sphere?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
